title: Add hash-route Wallet page and wire existing selected button to navigate to it

requirements.summary: Change only the user-selected button so its label is "Go to Wallet" and it navigates to the Wallet hash route when clicked.
acceptanceCriteria: Only the selected button’s text/behavior changes; no other UI text/buttons are modified.
The selected button’s visible text is exactly "Go to Wallet".
Clicking the selected button navigates to the Wallet route using the app’s hash routing (e.g., #/wallet).

file_operations.description: Update ONLY the selected form button element to: (1) render visible text exactly "Go to Wallet" (remove any additional icon/label text), and (2) on click, navigate via hash routing to "/wallet" (e.g., by setting window.location.hash). Ensure no other strings or buttons in this file are modified.

requirements.summary: Add a new /wallet hash route and render a Wallet page with a title and a Back to Dashboard action.
acceptanceCriteria: The router supports navigating to "/wallet" (hash route).
Navigating to #/wallet renders a Wallet page component.
The Wallet page has a clear title ("Wallet") and provides an in-app way to return to the Dashboard ("Back to Dashboard").

file_operations.description: Create a new Wallet page component that displays a clear page title "Wallet" and includes a "Back to Dashboard" control that navigates via hash routing to "/dashboard".
Extend the hash routing type/logic to recognize and return the "/wallet" route in addition to existing routes, so navigation to #/wallet is supported.
Wire the new "/wallet" route into the router so that when active it renders the new WalletPage component. Ensure navigation between routes continues to use hash routing.
